head.title: RYE: HOUSING INCENTIVE FOR A CITY MANAGER

hedline.hl1: RYE: HOUSING INCENTIVE FOR A CITY MANAGER

abstract.p: Officials in Rye, NY, are negotiating package with new city manager Julia Novak to pay her more than $160,000 over five years for housing (S)

block.p: Rye is negotiating a package with its new city manager to pay her more than $160,000 over five years for housing, Mayor Steven Otis said. A search firm hired by the city to find a new manager told Rye officials that increasingly communities with high housing costs were offering housing allowances in order to attract qualified candidates. Mayor Otis said the median price of a house in Rye is $649,500, with the average sale price last year reaching $840,700. Rye's charter requires that its city manager live in the municipality. The city manager, Julia Novak, is living in a rented house in Rye until the housing allowance is negotiated, the Mayor said. Meanwhile, the city is paying $2,700 a month for a short-term home rental for Ms. Novak, her husband and two children.
